summary: The Grocery Reform And Safety Act (GRAS Act) amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. It mandates notification to the FDA for new uses of substances considered "generally recognized as safe" (GRAS) and requires the FDA to review these notifications, including detailed safety data. It also mandates the FDA to periodically reassess the safety of GRAS substances, food additives, and related substances. Furthermore, the bill introduces fees for industry related to GRAS substance review and reassessment. The bill aims to improve the safety assessment and oversight of food substances.
